description:
Threadlock, or retaining compound, can be found on most bolts on your bicycle. It adds a bit more security to important bolts on your brakes, handlebars, and elsewhere, to ensure they remain tight enough to keep you riding safely. In this video, Alex talks you through threadlock, where you need to use it, and how it actually works.

description:
In 1990, Shimano changed road bike gears forever with the launch of the Shimano Total Integration system or, as it's better known, STI. Combining shifters with brake levers and moving away from down tube shifters changed the ways the pros raced and made road riding a lot more comfortable, ergonomic, and a little bit faster! In this video, Alex checks out what makes up an STI lever, and how they came about.

In association with Shimano: www.shimano.com

description:
Clipless pedals are often regarded as essential for road cyclists. They make you feel more connected to the bike, and improve your pedalling efficiency. However, shoes with cleats on the bottom are tricky to walk in, and it can be reassuring knowing you can quickly put a foot down if you need to! There are pros and cons to each pedal system so, in this video, we compare clipless and flat pedals to see which is best!

title: We Gave A Pro Mountain Biker A Gravel Bike And This Is What Happened

description:
Wheels are one of the best bang-for-your-buck upgrades you can make on your bike. Upgrading to a lightweight wheelset can make you spritely like a gazelle up your local hills, an aerodynamic wheelset can be all the difference when you're travelling at high speeds on the flat. Buying the right wheels for your steed can be complicated, disc brake vs rim brake, tubeless vs clincher, quick-release vs thru-axle, all of these choices are important to get right. Ollie is here to save the day, with a comprehensive guide on different types of wheels and what you should be able to get for your money!
